other_tests.findings: Bibasilar atelectasis noted; no pleural effusion or pneumothorax; normal size heart; no pericardial effusion; liver enhances homogeneously without focal liver lesions; normal gallbladder; no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation; normal spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands; kidneys enhance symmetrically; no hydronephrosis; no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy; no free air or free fluid; normal stomach and small bowel; unremarkable aorta and its major branches; patent portal vein, splenic vein and superior mesenteric vein; a dilated and thickened appendix measuring 1 cm with adjacent fat stranding; thickening of lateral conal fascia; no adjacent fluid collection or evidence of perforation; mildly prominent adjacent lymph nodes likely reactive; unremarkable remainder of the colon; normal bladder, prostate, and sigmoid; no free pelvic fluid.
